intro: Stellera concinna, commonly known as the starwort, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds, though it is not closely related to them. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers and its trailing growth habit. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Stellera concinna is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
